text: In this video, we will walk you through

how to create and play
your Spotify playlist.

We will be using the mobile
app for this tutorial,
but the steps work the same on desktop.

Once on the Spotify
app, go to Your Library.

Tap on the plus icon to
create a new playlist.

You can change the name
of your playlist here.
To add a description and an image,
tap the three-dot icon and select "Edit."
Then click "Save."
You can also tap the share icon here
to share your playlist with friends.
To add tracks, tap "Add songs."
Search for the song you want,
then tap the add icon.

Continue this process
for all songs you want
in this playlist.

You can also add songs
through the regular search.

Tap the search icon and type
in the name of the song.
Once you find it, tap the three-dot icon,
then select "Add to playlist,"
then choose your desired playlist.
To add an entire album,
type in the name in the search box,
then tap once you find it.
In the album page, tap the three-dot icon,
then select "Add to playlist,"
then choose your desired playlist.

To remove a track, go
back to your playlist,

find the song, then
tap the three-dot icon.
Select "Remove from this playlist."

Select your playlist,
then click the play icon.

Click the shuffle icon
if you want your playlist
to play random songs.

To add to the queue, click
on the three-dot icon

next to the track, then
select "Add to queue."
Select the song that's playing,
then tap the queue icon
to see the song that's coming up next.

You can skip songs or go
back by tapping the arrows
on both sides of the play icon.
